DOC.brief_title: L-Arginine , Symmetrical Asymmetrical Dimethylarginine ( SDMA/ADMA ) Acute Kidney Injury ( AKI )
DOC.detailed_description: Acute kidney injury ( AKI ) frequent complication severe implication deteriorate overall prognosis . Nitric oxide ( NO ) -signal transduction play important role mediate renal damage . NO produced NO-synthase ( NOS ) L-arginine substrate . Endogenous L-Arginine derivative , asymmetric symmetric dimethylarginines ( ADMA/SDMA ) , inhibit NO-production directly ( AMDA ) block NOS activity indirectly ( SDMA ) block cellular L-Arginine uptake . It well know SDMA ADMA marker renal function ( SDMA ) cardiovascular risk ( ADMA/SDMA ) patient chronic kidney disease ( CKD ) . Moreover , ADMA SDMA possibly even trigger cardiovascular risk patient CKD . However , little information regulation influence ADMA/SDMA acute kidney injury .
DOC.criteria: acute kidney injury accord definition AKIN ( Acute Kidney Injury Network ) start renal replacement therapy ( e.g . dialysis ) dialysis continuous venovenous hemofiltration recruitment recovery kidney injury accord definition AKIN ( Acute Kidney Injury Network ) palliative care life expectancy severely limited ( < six month ) due preexist malignancy disease
